signal.name: AtkComponent::bounds-changed
signal.description: The 'bounds-changed" signal is emitted when the bposition or size of the component changes.

parameter.name: atkcomponent
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

parameter.name: arg1
parameter.parameter_description: The AtkRectangle giving the new position and size.

enum.name: AtkCoordType
enum.description: Specifies how xy coordinates are to be interpreted. Used by functions such as atk_component_get_position() and atk_text_get_character_extents()

parameter.name: ATK_XY_SCREEN
parameter.parameter_description: specifies xy coordinates relative to the screen

parameter.name: ATK_XY_WINDOW
parameter.parameter_description: specifies xy coordinates relative to the widget's top-level window

parameter.name: ATK_XY_PARENT
parameter.parameter_description: specifies xy coordinates relative to the widget's immediate parent. Since: 2.30

signal.name: AtkDocument::load-complete
signal.description: The 'load-complete' signal is emitted when a pending load of a static document has completed. This signal is to be expected by ATK clients if and when AtkDocument implementors expose ATK_STATE_BUSY. If the state of an AtkObject which implements AtkDocument does not include ATK_STATE_BUSY, it should be safe for clients to assume that the AtkDocument's static contents are fully loaded into the container. (Dynamic document contents should be exposed via other signals.)

parameter.name: atkdocument
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

signal.name: AtkDocument::load-stopped
signal.description: The 'load-stopped' signal is emitted when a pending load of document contents is cancelled, paused, or otherwise interrupted by the user or application logic. It should not however be emitted while waiting for a resource (for instance while blocking on a file or network read) unless a user-significant timeout has occurred.

parameter.name: atkdocument
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

signal.name: AtkDocument::page-changed
signal.description:
The 'page-changed' signal is emitted when the current page of a document changes, e.g. pressing page up/down in a document viewer.
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: atkdocument
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal was emitted

parameter.name: page_number
parameter.parameter_description: the new page number. If this value is unknown or not applicable, -1 should be provided.

signal.name: AtkDocument::reload
signal.description: The 'reload' signal is emitted when the contents of a document is refreshed from its source. Once 'reload' has been emitted, a matching 'load-complete' or 'load-stopped' signal should follow, which clients may await before interrogating ATK for the latest document content.

parameter.name: atkdocument
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

signal.name: AtkHyperlink::link-activated
signal.description: The signal link-activated is emitted when a link is activated.

parameter.name: atkhyperlink
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

property.name: AtkHyperlink:selected-link
property.description:
Selected link
Deprecated: 1.8: Please use ATK_STATE_FOCUSABLE for all links, and ATK_STATE_FOCUSED for focused links.

parameter.name: ATK_HYPERLINK_IS_INLINE
parameter.parameter_description: Link is inline

signal.name: AtkHypertext::link-selected
signal.description: The "link-selected" signal is emitted by an AtkHyperText object when one of the hyperlinks associated with the object is selected.

parameter.name: atkhypertext
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

parameter.name: arg1
parameter.parameter_description: the index of the hyperlink which is selected

enum.name: AtkKeyEventType
enum.description: Specifies the type of a keyboard evemt.

parameter.name: ATK_KEY_EVENT_PRESS
parameter.parameter_description: specifies a key press event

parameter.name: ATK_KEY_EVENT_RELEASE
parameter.parameter_description: specifies a key release event

parameter.name: ATK_KEY_EVENT_LAST_DEFINED
parameter.parameter_description: Not a valid value; specifies end of enumeration

enum.name: AtkLayer
enum.description:
Describes the layer of a component
These enumerated "layer values" are used when determining which UI rendering layer a component is drawn into, which can help in making determinations of when components occlude one another.

parameter.name: ATK_LAYER_INVALID
parameter.parameter_description: The object does not have a layer

parameter.name: ATK_LAYER_BACKGROUND
parameter.parameter_description: This layer is reserved for the desktop background

parameter.name: ATK_LAYER_CANVAS
parameter.parameter_description: This layer is used for Canvas components

parameter.name: ATK_LAYER_WIDGET
parameter.parameter_description: This layer is normally used for components

parameter.name: ATK_LAYER_MDI
parameter.parameter_description: This layer is used for layered components

parameter.name: ATK_LAYER_POPUP
parameter.parameter_description: This layer is used for popup components, such as menus

parameter.name: ATK_LAYER_OVERLAY
parameter.parameter_description: This layer is reserved for future use.

parameter.name: ATK_LAYER_WINDOW
parameter.parameter_description: This layer is used for toplevel windows.

signal.name: AtkObject::active-descendant-changed
signal.description: The "active-descendant-changed" signal is emitted by an object which has the state ATK_STATE_MANAGES_DESCENDANTS when the focus object in the object changes. For instance, a table will emit the signal when the cell in the table which has focus changes.

parameter.name: atkobject
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

parameter.name: arg1
parameter.parameter_description: the newly focused object.

signal.name: AtkObject::children-changed
signal.description: The signal "children-changed" is emitted when a child is added or removed form an object. It supports two details: "add" and "remove"

parameter.name: atkobject
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

parameter.name: arg1
parameter.parameter_description: The index of the added or removed child. The value can be -1. This is used if the value is not known by the implementor when the child is added/removed or irrelevant.

parameter.name: arg2
parameter.parameter_description: A gpointer to the child AtkObject which was added or removed. If the child was removed, it is possible that it is not available for the implementor. In that case this pointer can be NULL.

signal.name: AtkObject::focus-event
signal.description:
The signal "focus-event" is emitted when an object gained or lost focus.
Deprecated: 2.9.4: Use the #AtkObject::state-change signal instead.

parameter.name: atkobject
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal

parameter.name: arg1
parameter.parameter_description: a boolean value which indicates whether the object gained or lost focus.

signal.name: AtkObject::property-change
signal.description:
The signal "property-change" is emitted when an object's property value changes. @arg1 contains an #AtkPropertyValues with the name and the new value of the property whose value has changed. Note that, as with GObject notify, getting this signal does not guarantee that the value of the property has actually changed; it may also be emitted when the setter of the property is called to reinstate the previous value.
Toolkit implementor note: ATK implementors should use g_object_notify() to emit property-changed notifications. #AtkObject::property-changed is needed by the implementation of atk_add_global_event_listener() because GObject notify doesn't support emission hooks.

parameter.name: atkobject
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

parameter.name: arg1
parameter.parameter_description: an #AtkPropertyValues containing the new value of the property which changed.

signal.name: AtkObject::state-change
signal.description: The "state-change" signal is emitted when an object's state changes. The detail value identifies the state type which has changed.

parameter.name: atkobject
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

parameter.name: arg1
parameter.parameter_description: The name of the state which has changed

parameter.name: arg2
parameter.parameter_description: A boolean which indicates whether the state has been set or unset.

signal.name: AtkObject::visible-data-changed
signal.description: The "visible-data-changed" signal is emitted when the visual appearance of the object changed.

parameter.name: atkobject
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

property.name: AtkObject:accessible-table-caption
property.description:
Table caption.
Deprecated: Since 1.3. Use table-caption-object instead.

property.name: AtkObject:accessible-table-column-description
property.description:
Accessible table column description.
Deprecated: Since 2.12. Use atk_table_get_column_description() and atk_table_set_column_description() instead.

property.name: AtkObject:accessible-table-column-header
property.description:
Accessible table column header.
Deprecated: Since 2.12. Use atk_table_get_column_header() and atk_table_set_column_header() instead.

property.name: AtkObject:accessible-table-row-description
property.description:
Accessible table row description.
Deprecated: Since 2.12. Use atk_table_get_row_description() and atk_table_set_row_description() instead.

property.name: AtkObject:accessible-table-row-header
property.description:
Accessible table row header.
Deprecated: Since 2.12. Use atk_table_get_row_header() and atk_table_set_row_header() instead.

property.name: AtkObject:accessible-value
property.description:
Numeric value of this object, in case being and AtkValue.
Deprecated: Since 2.12. Use atk_value_get_value_and_text() to get the value, and value-changed signal to be notified on their value changes.

enum.name: AtkRelationType
enum.description: Describes the type of the relation

parameter.name: ATK_RELATION_NULL
parameter.parameter_description: Not used, represens "no relationship" or an error condition.

parameter.name: ATK_RELATION_CONTROLLED_BY
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates an object controlled by one or more target objects.

parameter.name: ATK_RELATION_CONTROLLER_FOR
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates an object is an controller for one or more target objects.

parameter.name: ATK_RELATION_LABEL_FOR
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates an object is a label for one or more target objects.

parameter.name: ATK_RELATION_LABELLED_BY
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates an object is labelled by one or more target objects.

parameter.name: ATK_RELATION_MEMBER_OF
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates an object is a member of a group of one or more target objects.

parameter.name: ATK_RELATION_NODE_CHILD_OF
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates an object is a cell in a treetable which is displayed because a cell in the same column is expanded and identifies that cell.

parameter.name: ATK_RELATION_FLOWS_TO
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates that the object has content that flows logically to another AtkObject in a sequential way, (for instance text-flow).

parameter.name: ATK_RELATION_FLOWS_FROM
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates that the object has content that flows logically from another AtkObject in a sequential way, (for instance text-flow).

parameter.name: ATK_RELATION_SUBWINDOW_OF
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates a subwindow attached to a component but otherwise has no connection in the UI heirarchy to that component.

parameter.name: ATK_RELATION_EMBEDS
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates that the object visually embeds another object's content, i.e. this object's content flows around another's content.

parameter.name: ATK_RELATION_EMBEDDED_BY
parameter.parameter_description: Reciprocal of %ATK_RELATION_EMBEDS, indicates that this object's content is visualy embedded in another object.

parameter.name: ATK_RELATION_POPUP_FOR
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates that an object is a popup for another object.

parameter.name: ATK_RELATION_PARENT_WINDOW_OF
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates that an object is a parent window of another object.

parameter.name: ATK_RELATION_DESCRIBED_BY
parameter.parameter_description: Reciprocal of %ATK_RELATION_DESCRIPTION_FOR. Indicates that one or more target objects provide descriptive information about this object. This relation type is most appropriate for information that is not essential as its presentation may be user-configurable and/or limited to an on-demand mechanism such as an assistive technology command. For brief, essential information such as can be found in a widget's on-screen label, use %ATK_RELATION_LABELLED_BY. For an on-screen error message, use %ATK_RELATION_ERROR_MESSAGE. For lengthy extended descriptive information contained in an on-screen object, consider using %ATK_RELATION_DETAILS as assistive technologies may provide a means for the user to navigate to objects containing detailed descriptions so that their content can be more closely reviewed.

parameter.name: ATK_RELATION_DESCRIPTION_FOR
parameter.parameter_description: Reciprocal of %ATK_RELATION_DESCRIBED_BY. Indicates that this object provides descriptive information about the target object(s). See also %ATK_RELATION_DETAILS_FOR and %ATK_RELATION_ERROR_FOR.

parameter.name: ATK_RELATION_NODE_PARENT_OF
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates an object is a cell in a treetable and is expanded to display other cells in the same column.

parameter.name: ATK_RELATION_DETAILS
parameter.parameter_description: Reciprocal of %ATK_RELATION_DETAILS_FOR. Indicates that this object has a detailed or extended description, the contents of which can be found in the target object(s). This relation type is most appropriate for information that is sufficiently lengthy as to make navigation to the container of that information desirable. For less verbose information suitable for announcement only, see %ATK_RELATION_DESCRIBED_BY. If the detailed information describes an error condition, %ATK_RELATION_ERROR_FOR should be used instead. @Since: ATK-2.26.

parameter.name: ATK_RELATION_DETAILS_FOR
parameter.parameter_description: Reciprocal of %ATK_RELATION_DETAILS. Indicates that this object provides a detailed or extended description about the target object(s). See also %ATK_RELATION_DESCRIPTION_FOR and %ATK_RELATION_ERROR_FOR. @Since: ATK-2.26.

parameter.name: ATK_RELATION_ERROR_MESSAGE
parameter.parameter_description: Reciprocal of %ATK_RELATION_ERROR_FOR. Indicates that this object has one or more errors, the nature of which is described in the contents of the target object(s). Objects that have this relation type should also contain %ATK_STATE_INVALID_ENTRY in their #AtkStateSet. @Since: ATK-2.26.

parameter.name: ATK_RELATION_ERROR_FOR
parameter.parameter_description: Reciprocal of %ATK_RELATION_ERROR_MESSAGE. Indicates that this object contains an error message describing an invalid condition in the target object(s). @Since: ATK_2.26.

parameter.name: ATK_RELATION_LAST_DEFINED
parameter.parameter_description: Not used, this value indicates the end of the enumeration.

enum.name: AtkRole
enum.description:
Describes the role of an object
These are the built-in enumerated roles that UI components can have in ATK. Other roles may be added at runtime, so an AtkRole >= %ATK_ROLE_LAST_DEFINED is not necessarily an error.

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_INVALID
parameter.parameter_description: Invalid role

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_ACCEL_LABEL
parameter.parameter_description: A label which represents an accelerator

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_ALERT
parameter.parameter_description: An object which is an alert to the user. Assistive Technologies typically respond to ATK_ROLE_ALERT by reading the entire onscreen contents of containers advertising this role. Should be used for warning dialogs, etc.

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_ANIMATION
parameter.parameter_description: An object which is an animated image

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_ARROW
parameter.parameter_description: An arrow in one of the four cardinal directions

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_CALENDAR
parameter.parameter_description: An object that displays a calendar and allows the user to select a date

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_CANVAS
parameter.parameter_description: An object that can be drawn into and is used to trap events

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_CHECK_BOX
parameter.parameter_description: A choice that can be checked or unchecked and provides a separate indicator for the current state

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_CHECK_MENU_ITEM
parameter.parameter_description: A menu item with a check box

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_COLOR_CHOOSER
parameter.parameter_description: A specialized dialog that lets the user choose a color

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_COLUMN_HEADER
parameter.parameter_description: The header for a column of data

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_COMBO_BOX
parameter.parameter_description: A collapsible list of choices the user can select from

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_DATE_EDITOR
parameter.parameter_description: An object whose purpose is to allow a user to edit a date

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_DESKTOP_ICON
parameter.parameter_description: An inconifed internal frame within a DESKTOP_PANE

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_DESKTOP_FRAME
parameter.parameter_description: A pane that supports internal frames and iconified versions of those internal frames

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_DIAL
parameter.parameter_description: An object whose purpose is to allow a user to set a value

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_DIALOG
parameter.parameter_description: A top level window with title bar and a border

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_DIRECTORY_PANE
parameter.parameter_description: A pane that allows the user to navigate through and select the contents of a directory

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_DRAWING_AREA
parameter.parameter_description: An object used for drawing custom user interface elements

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_FILE_CHOOSER
parameter.parameter_description: A specialized dialog that lets the user choose a file

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_FILLER
parameter.parameter_description: A object that fills up space in a user interface

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_FONT_CHOOSER
parameter.parameter_description: A specialized dialog that lets the user choose a font

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_FRAME
parameter.parameter_description: A top level window with a title bar, border, menubar, etc.

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_GLASS_PANE
parameter.parameter_description: A pane that is guaranteed to be painted on top of all panes beneath it

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_HTML_CONTAINER
parameter.parameter_description: A document container for HTML, whose children represent the document content

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_ICON
parameter.parameter_description: A small fixed size picture, typically used to decorate components

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_IMAGE
parameter.parameter_description: An object whose primary purpose is to display an image

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_INTERNAL_FRAME
parameter.parameter_description: A frame-like object that is clipped by a desktop pane

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_LABEL
parameter.parameter_description: An object used to present an icon or short string in an interface

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_LAYERED_PANE
parameter.parameter_description: A specialized pane that allows its children to be drawn in layers, providing a form of stacking order

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_LIST
parameter.parameter_description: An object that presents a list of objects to the user and allows the user to select one or more of them

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_LIST_ITEM
parameter.parameter_description: An object that represents an element of a list

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_MENU
parameter.parameter_description: An object usually found inside a menu bar that contains a list of actions the user can choose from

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_MENU_BAR
parameter.parameter_description: An object usually drawn at the top of the primary dialog box of an application that contains a list of menus the user can choose from

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_MENU_ITEM
parameter.parameter_description: An object usually contained in a menu that presents an action the user can choose

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_OPTION_PANE
parameter.parameter_description: A specialized pane whose primary use is inside a DIALOG

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_PAGE_TAB
parameter.parameter_description: An object that is a child of a page tab list

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_PAGE_TAB_LIST
parameter.parameter_description: An object that presents a series of panels (or page tabs), one at a time, through some mechanism provided by the object

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_PANEL
parameter.parameter_description: A generic container that is often used to group objects

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_PASSWORD_TEXT
parameter.parameter_description: A text object uses for passwords, or other places where the text content is not shown visibly to the user

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_POPUP_MENU
parameter.parameter_description: A temporary window that is usually used to offer the user a list of choices, and then hides when the user selects one of those choices

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_PROGRESS_BAR
parameter.parameter_description: An object used to indicate how much of a task has been completed

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_PUSH_BUTTON
parameter.parameter_description: An object the user can manipulate to tell the application to do something

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_RADIO_BUTTON
parameter.parameter_description: A specialized check box that will cause other radio buttons in the same group to become unchecked when this one is checked

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_RADIO_MENU_ITEM
parameter.parameter_description: A check menu item which belongs to a group. At each instant exactly one of the radio menu items from a group is selected

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_ROOT_PANE
parameter.parameter_description: A specialized pane that has a glass pane and a layered pane as its children

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_ROW_HEADER
parameter.parameter_description: The header for a row of data

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_SCROLL_BAR
parameter.parameter_description: An object usually used to allow a user to incrementally view a large amount of data.

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_SCROLL_PANE
parameter.parameter_description: An object that allows a user to incrementally view a large amount of information

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_SEPARATOR
parameter.parameter_description: An object usually contained in a menu to provide a visible and logical separation of the contents in a menu

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_SLIDER
parameter.parameter_description: An object that allows the user to select from a bounded range

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_SPLIT_PANE
parameter.parameter_description: A specialized panel that presents two other panels at the same time

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_SPIN_BUTTON
parameter.parameter_description: An object used to get an integer or floating point number from the user

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_STATUSBAR
parameter.parameter_description: An object which reports messages of minor importance to the user

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_TABLE
parameter.parameter_description: An object used to represent information in terms of rows and columns

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_TABLE_CELL
parameter.parameter_description: A cell in a table

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_TABLE_COLUMN_HEADER
parameter.parameter_description: The header for a column of a table

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_TABLE_ROW_HEADER
parameter.parameter_description: The header for a row of a table

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_TEAR_OFF_MENU_ITEM
parameter.parameter_description: A menu item used to tear off and reattach its menu

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_TERMINAL
parameter.parameter_description: An object that represents an accessible terminal. (Since: 0.6)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_TEXT
parameter.parameter_description: An interactive widget that supports multiple lines of text and optionally accepts user input, but whose purpose is not to solicit user input. Thus ATK_ROLE_TEXT is appropriate for the text view in a plain text editor but inappropriate for an input field in a dialog box or web form. For widgets whose purpose is to solicit input from the user, see ATK_ROLE_ENTRY and ATK_ROLE_PASSWORD_TEXT. For generic objects which display a brief amount of textual information, see ATK_ROLE_STATIC.

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_TOGGLE_BUTTON
parameter.parameter_description: A specialized push button that can be checked or unchecked, but does not provide a separate indicator for the current state

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_TOOL_BAR
parameter.parameter_description: A bar or palette usually composed of push buttons or toggle buttons

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_TOOL_TIP
parameter.parameter_description: An object that provides information about another object

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_TREE
parameter.parameter_description: An object used to represent hierarchical information to the user

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_TREE_TABLE
parameter.parameter_description: An object capable of expanding and collapsing rows as well as showing multiple columns of data. (Since: 0.7)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_UNKNOWN
parameter.parameter_description: The object contains some Accessible information, but its role is not known

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_VIEWPORT
parameter.parameter_description: An object usually used in a scroll pane

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_WINDOW
parameter.parameter_description: A top level window with no title or border.

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_HEADER
parameter.parameter_description: An object that serves as a document header. (Since: 1.1.1)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_FOOTER
parameter.parameter_description: An object that serves as a document footer. (Since: 1.1.1)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_PARAGRAPH
parameter.parameter_description: An object which is contains a paragraph of text content. (Since: 1.1.1)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_RULER
parameter.parameter_description: An object which describes margins and tab stops, etc. for text objects which it controls (should have CONTROLLER_FOR relation to such). (Since: 1.1.1)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_APPLICATION
parameter.parameter_description: The object is an application object, which may contain @ATK_ROLE_FRAME objects or other types of accessibles. The root accessible of any application's ATK hierarchy should have ATK_ROLE_APPLICATION. (Since: 1.1.4)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_AUTOCOMPLETE
parameter.parameter_description: The object is a dialog or list containing items for insertion into an entry widget, for instance a list of words for completion of a text entry. (Since: 1.3)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_EDITBAR
parameter.parameter_description: The object is an editable text object in a toolbar. (Since: 1.5)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_EMBEDDED
parameter.parameter_description: The object is an embedded container within a document or panel. This role is a grouping "hint" indicating that the contained objects share a context. (Since: 1.7.2)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_ENTRY
parameter.parameter_description: The object is a component whose textual content may be entered or modified by the user, provided @ATK_STATE_EDITABLE is present. (Since: 1.11)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_CHART
parameter.parameter_description: The object is a graphical depiction of quantitative data. It may contain multiple subelements whose attributes and/or description may be queried to obtain both the quantitative data and information about how the data is being presented. The LABELLED_BY relation is particularly important in interpreting objects of this type, as is the accessible-description property. (Since: 1.11)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_CAPTION
parameter.parameter_description: The object contains descriptive information, usually textual, about another user interface element such as a table, chart, or image. (Since: 1.11)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_DOCUMENT_FRAME
parameter.parameter_description: The object is a visual frame or container which contains a view of document content. Document frames may occur within another Document instance, in which case the second document may be said to be embedded in the containing instance. HTML frames are often ROLE_DOCUMENT_FRAME. Either this object, or a singleton descendant, should implement the Document interface. (Since: 1.11)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_HEADING
parameter.parameter_description: The object serves as a heading for content which follows it in a document. The 'heading level' of the heading, if availabe, may be obtained by querying the object's attributes.

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_PAGE
parameter.parameter_description: The object is a containing instance which encapsulates a page of information. @ATK_ROLE_PAGE is used in documents and content which support a paginated navigation model. (Since: 1.11)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_SECTION
parameter.parameter_description: The object is a containing instance of document content which constitutes a particular 'logical' section of the document. The type of content within a section, and the nature of the section division itself, may be obtained by querying the object's attributes. Sections may be nested. (Since: 1.11)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_REDUNDANT_OBJECT
parameter.parameter_description: The object is redundant with another object in the hierarchy, and is exposed for purely technical reasons. Objects of this role should normally be ignored by clients. (Since: 1.11)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_FORM
parameter.parameter_description: The object is a container for form controls, for instance as part of a web form or user-input form within a document. This role is primarily a tag/convenience for clients when navigating complex documents, it is not expected that ordinary GUI containers will always have ATK_ROLE_FORM. (Since: 1.12.0)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_LINK
parameter.parameter_description: The object is a hypertext anchor, i.e. a "link" in a hypertext document. Such objects are distinct from 'inline' content which may also use the Hypertext/Hyperlink interfaces to indicate the range/location within a text object where an inline or embedded object lies. (Since: 1.12.1)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_INPUT_METHOD_WINDOW
parameter.parameter_description: The object is a window or similar viewport which is used to allow composition or input of a 'complex character', in other words it is an "input method window." (Since: 1.12.1)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_TABLE_ROW
parameter.parameter_description: A row in a table. (Since: 2.1.0)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_TREE_ITEM
parameter.parameter_description: An object that represents an element of a tree. (Since: 2.1.0)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_DOCUMENT_SPREADSHEET
parameter.parameter_description: A document frame which contains a spreadsheet. (Since: 2.1.0)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_DOCUMENT_PRESENTATION
parameter.parameter_description: A document frame which contains a presentation or slide content. (Since: 2.1.0)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_DOCUMENT_TEXT
parameter.parameter_description: A document frame which contains textual content, such as found in a word processing application. (Since: 2.1.0)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_DOCUMENT_WEB
parameter.parameter_description: A document frame which contains HTML or other markup suitable for display in a web browser. (Since: 2.1.0)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_DOCUMENT_EMAIL
parameter.parameter_description: A document frame which contains email content to be displayed or composed either in plain text or HTML. (Since: 2.1.0)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_COMMENT
parameter.parameter_description: An object found within a document and designed to present a comment, note, or other annotation. In some cases, this object might not be visible until activated. (Since: 2.1.0)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_LIST_BOX
parameter.parameter_description: A non-collapsible list of choices the user can select from. (Since: 2.1.0)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_GROUPING
parameter.parameter_description: A group of related widgets. This group typically has a label. (Since: 2.1.0)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_IMAGE_MAP
parameter.parameter_description: An image map object. Usually a graphic with multiple hotspots, where each hotspot can be activated resulting in the loading of another document or section of a document. (Since: 2.1.0)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_NOTIFICATION
parameter.parameter_description: A transitory object designed to present a message to the user, typically at the desktop level rather than inside a particular application. (Since: 2.1.0)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_INFO_BAR
parameter.parameter_description: An object designed to present a message to the user within an existing window. (Since: 2.1.0)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_LEVEL_BAR
parameter.parameter_description: A bar that serves as a level indicator to, for instance, show the strength of a password or the state of a battery. (Since: 2.7.3)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_TITLE_BAR
parameter.parameter_description: A bar that serves as the title of a window or a dialog. (Since: 2.12)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_BLOCK_QUOTE
parameter.parameter_description: An object which contains a text section that is quoted from another source. (Since: 2.12)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_AUDIO
parameter.parameter_description: An object which represents an audio element. (Since: 2.12)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_VIDEO
parameter.parameter_description: An object which represents a video element. (Since: 2.12)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_DEFINITION
parameter.parameter_description: A definition of a term or concept. (Since: 2.12)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_ARTICLE
parameter.parameter_description: A section of a page that consists of a composition that forms an independent part of a document, page, or site. Examples: A blog entry, a news story, a forum post. (Since: 2.12)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_LANDMARK
parameter.parameter_description: A region of a web page intended as a navigational landmark. This is designed to allow Assistive Technologies to provide quick navigation among key regions within a document. (Since: 2.12)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_LOG
parameter.parameter_description: A text widget or container holding log content, such as chat history and error logs. In this role there is a relationship between the arrival of new items in the log and the reading order. The log contains a meaningful sequence and new information is added only to the end of the log, not at arbitrary points. (Since: 2.12)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_MARQUEE
parameter.parameter_description: A container where non-essential information changes frequently. Common usages of marquee include stock tickers and ad banners. The primary difference between a marquee and a log is that logs usually have a meaningful order or sequence of important content changes. (Since: 2.12)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_MATH
parameter.parameter_description: A text widget or container that holds a mathematical expression. (Since: 2.12)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_RATING
parameter.parameter_description: A widget whose purpose is to display a rating, such as the number of stars associated with a song in a media player. Objects of this role should also implement AtkValue. (Since: 2.12)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_TIMER
parameter.parameter_description: An object containing a numerical counter which indicates an amount of elapsed time from a start point, or the time remaining until an end point. (Since: 2.12)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_DESCRIPTION_LIST
parameter.parameter_description: An object that represents a list of term-value groups. A term-value group represents a individual description and consist of one or more names (ATK_ROLE_DESCRIPTION_TERM) followed by one or more values (ATK_ROLE_DESCRIPTION_VALUE). For each list, there should not be more than one group with the same term name. (Since: 2.12)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_DESCRIPTION_TERM
parameter.parameter_description: An object that represents a term or phrase with a corresponding definition. (Since: 2.12)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_DESCRIPTION_VALUE
parameter.parameter_description: An object that represents the description, definition or value of a term. (Since: 2.12)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_STATIC
parameter.parameter_description: A generic non-container object whose purpose is to display a brief amount of information to the user and whose role is known by the implementor but lacks semantic value for the user. Examples in which %ATK_ROLE_STATIC is appropriate include the message displayed in a message box and an image used as an alternative means to display text. %ATK_ROLE_STATIC should not be applied to widgets which are traditionally interactive, objects which display a significant amount of content, or any object which has an accessible relation pointing to another object. Implementors should expose the displayed information through the accessible name of the object. If doing so seems inappropriate, it may indicate that a different role should be used. For labels which describe another widget, see %ATK_ROLE_LABEL. For text views, see %ATK_ROLE_TEXT. For generic containers, see %ATK_ROLE_PANEL. For objects whose role is not known by the implementor, see %ATK_ROLE_UNKNOWN. (Since: 2.16)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_MATH_FRACTION
parameter.parameter_description: An object that represents a mathematical fraction. (Since: 2.16)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_MATH_ROOT
parameter.parameter_description: An object that represents a mathematical expression displayed with a radical. (Since: 2.16)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_SUBSCRIPT
parameter.parameter_description: An object that contains text that is displayed as a subscript. (Since: 2.16)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_SUPERSCRIPT
parameter.parameter_description: An object that contains text that is displayed as a superscript. (Since: 2.16)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_FOOTNOTE
parameter.parameter_description: An object that contains the text of a footnote. (Since: 2.26)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_CONTENT_DELETION
ATK_ROLE_CONTENT_INSERTION
ATK_ROLE_MARK
parameter.parameter_description: A run of content that is marked or highlighted, such as for reference purposes, or to call it out as having a special purpose. If the marked content has an associated section in the document elaborating on the reason for the mark, then %ATK_RELATION_DETAILS should be used on the mark to point to that associated section. In addition, the reciprocal relation %ATK_RELATION_DETAILS_FOR should be used on the associated content section to point back to the mark. (Since: 2.36)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_SUGGESTION
parameter.parameter_description: A container for content that is called out as a proposed change from the current version of the document, such as by a reviewer of the content. This role should include either %ATK_ROLE_CONTENT_DELETION and/or %ATK_ROLE_CONTENT_INSERTION children, in any order, to indicate what the actual change is. (Since: 2.36)

parameter.name: ATK_ROLE_LAST_DEFINED
parameter.parameter_description: not a valid role, used for finding end of the enumeration

enum.name: AtkScrollType
enum.description:
Specifies where an object should be placed on the screen when using scroll_to.
Since: 2.30

parameter.name: ATK_SCROLL_TOP_LEFT
parameter.parameter_description: Scroll the object vertically and horizontally to bring its top left corner to the top left corner of the window.

parameter.name: ATK_SCROLL_BOTTOM_RIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: Scroll the object vertically and horizontally to bring its bottom right corner to the bottom right corner of the window.

parameter.name: ATK_SCROLL_TOP_EDGE
parameter.parameter_description: Scroll the object vertically to bring its top edge to the top edge of the window.

parameter.name: ATK_SCROLL_BOTTOM_EDGE
parameter.parameter_description: Scroll the object vertically to bring its bottom edge to the bottom edge of the window.

parameter.name: ATK_SCROLL_LEFT_EDGE
parameter.parameter_description: Scroll the object vertically and horizontally to bring its left edge to the left edge of the window.

parameter.name: ATK_SCROLL_RIGHT_EDGE
parameter.parameter_description: Scroll the object vertically and horizontally to bring its right edge to the right edge of the window.

parameter.name: ATK_SCROLL_ANYWHERE
parameter.parameter_description: Scroll the object vertically and horizontally so that as much as possible of the object becomes visible. The exact placement is determined by the application.

signal.name: AtkSelection::selection-changed
signal.description: The "selection-changed" signal is emitted by an object which implements AtkSelection interface when the selection changes.

parameter.name: atkselection
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

enum.name: AtkStateType
enum.description: The possible types of states of an object

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_INVALID
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates an invalid state - probably an error condition.

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_ACTIVE
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates a window is currently the active window, or an object is the active subelement within a container or table. ATK_STATE_ACTIVE should not be used for objects which have ATK_STATE_FOCUSABLE or ATK_STATE_SELECTABLE: Those objects should use ATK_STATE_FOCUSED and ATK_STATE_SELECTED respectively. ATK_STATE_ACTIVE is a means to indicate that an object which is not focusable and not selectable is the currently-active item within its parent container.

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_ARMED
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates that the object is 'armed', i.e. will be activated by if a pointer button-release event occurs within its bounds. Buttons often enter this state when a pointer click occurs within their bounds, as a precursor to activation. ATK_STATE_ARMED has been deprecated since ATK-2.16 and should not be used in newly-written code.

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_BUSY
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates the current object is busy, i.e. onscreen representation is in the process of changing, or the object is temporarily unavailable for interaction due to activity already in progress. This state may be used by implementors of Document to indicate that content loading is underway. It also may indicate other 'pending' conditions; clients may wish to interrogate this object when the ATK_STATE_BUSY flag is removed.

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_CHECKED
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates this object is currently checked, for instance a checkbox is 'non-empty'.

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_DEFUNCT
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates that this object no longer has a valid backing widget (for instance, if its peer object has been destroyed)

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_EDITABLE
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates that this object can contain text, and that the user can change the textual contents of this object by editing those contents directly. For an object which is expected to be editable due to its type, but which cannot be edited due to the application or platform preventing the user from doing so, that object's #AtkStateSet should lack ATK_STATE_EDITABLE and should contain ATK_STATE_READ_ONLY.

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_ENABLED
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates that this object is enabled, i.e. that it currently reflects some application state. Objects that are "greyed out" may lack this state, and may lack the STATE_SENSITIVE if direct user interaction cannot cause them to acquire STATE_ENABLED. See also: ATK_STATE_SENSITIVE

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_EXPANDABLE
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates this object allows progressive disclosure of its children

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_EXPANDED
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates this object its expanded - see ATK_STATE_EXPANDABLE above

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_FOCUSABLE
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates this object can accept keyboard focus, which means all events resulting from typing on the keyboard will normally be passed to it when it has focus

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_FOCUSED
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates this object currently has the keyboard focus

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_HORIZONTAL
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates the orientation of this object is horizontal; used, for instance, by objects of ATK_ROLE_SCROLL_BAR. For objects where vertical/horizontal orientation is especially meaningful.

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_ICONIFIED
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates this object is minimized and is represented only by an icon

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_MODAL
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates something must be done with this object before the user can interact with an object in a different window

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_MULTI_LINE
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates this (text) object can contain multiple lines of text

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_MULTISELECTABLE
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates this object allows more than one of its children to be selected at the same time, or in the case of text objects, that the object supports non-contiguous text selections.

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_OPAQUE
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates this object paints every pixel within its rectangular region.

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_PRESSED
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates this object is currently pressed.

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_RESIZABLE
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates the size of this object is not fixed

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_SELECTABLE
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates this object is the child of an object that allows its children to be selected and that this child is one of those children that can be selected

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_SELECTED
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates this object is the child of an object that allows its children to be selected and that this child is one of those children that has been selected

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_SENSITIVE
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates this object is sensitive, e.g. to user interaction. STATE_SENSITIVE usually accompanies STATE_ENABLED for user-actionable controls, but may be found in the absence of STATE_ENABLED if the current visible state of the control is "disconnected" from the application state. In such cases, direct user interaction can often result in the object gaining STATE_SENSITIVE, for instance if a user makes an explicit selection using an object whose current state is ambiguous or undefined. @see STATE_ENABLED, STATE_INDETERMINATE.

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_SHOWING
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates this object, the object's parent, the object's parent's parent, and so on, are all 'shown' to the end-user, i.e. subject to "exposure" if blocking or obscuring objects do not interpose between this object and the top of the window stack.

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_SINGLE_LINE
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates this (text) object can contain only a single line of text

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_STALE
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates that the information returned for this object may no longer be synchronized with the application state. This is implied if the object has STATE_TRANSIENT, and can also occur towards the end of the object peer's lifecycle. It can also be used to indicate that the index associated with this object has changed since the user accessed the object (in lieu of "index-in-parent-changed" events).

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_TRANSIENT
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates this object is transient, i.e. a snapshot which may not emit events when its state changes. Data from objects with ATK_STATE_TRANSIENT should not be cached, since there may be no notification given when the cached data becomes obsolete.

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_VERTICAL
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates the orientation of this object is vertical

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_VISIBLE
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates this object is visible, e.g. has been explicitly marked for exposure to the user. **note**: %ATK_STATE_VISIBLE is no guarantee that the object is actually unobscured on the screen, only that it is 'potentially' visible, barring obstruction, being scrolled or clipped out of the field of view, or having an ancestor container that has not yet made visible. A widget is potentially onscreen if it has both %ATK_STATE_VISIBLE and %ATK_STATE_SHOWING. The absence of %ATK_STATE_VISIBLE and %ATK_STATE_SHOWING is semantically equivalent to saying that an object is 'hidden'. See also %ATK_STATE_TRUNCATED, which applies if an object with %ATK_STATE_VISIBLE and %ATK_STATE_SHOWING set lies within a viewport which means that its contents are clipped, e.g. a truncated spreadsheet cell or an image within a scrolling viewport. Mostly useful for screen-review and magnification algorithms.

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_MANAGES_DESCENDANTS
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates that "active-descendant-changed" event is sent when children become 'active' (i.e. are selected or navigated to onscreen). Used to prevent need to enumerate all children in very large containers, like tables. The presence of STATE_MANAGES_DESCENDANTS is an indication to the client. that the children should not, and need not, be enumerated by the client. Objects implementing this state are expected to provide relevant state notifications to listening clients, for instance notifications of visibility changes and activation of their contained child objects, without the client having previously requested references to those children.

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_INDETERMINATE
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates that the value, or some other quantifiable property, of this AtkObject cannot be fully determined. In the case of a large data set in which the total number of items in that set is unknown (e.g. 1 of 999+), implementors should expose the currently-known set size (999) along with this state. In the case of a check box, this state should be used to indicate that the check box is a tri-state check box which is currently neither checked nor unchecked.

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_TRUNCATED
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates that an object is truncated, e.g. a text value in a speradsheet cell.

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_REQUIRED
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates that explicit user interaction with an object is required by the user interface, e.g. a required field in a "web-form" interface.

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_INVALID_ENTRY
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates that the object has encountered an error condition due to failure of input validation. For instance, a form control may acquire this state in response to invalid or malformed user input.

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_SUPPORTS_AUTOCOMPLETION
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates that the object in question implements some form of typeahead or pre-selection behavior whereby entering the first character of one or more sub-elements causes those elements to scroll into view or become selected. Subsequent character input may narrow the selection further as long as one or more sub-elements match the string. This state is normally only useful and encountered on objects that implement Selection. In some cases the typeahead behavior may result in full or partial completion of the data in the input field, in which case these input events may trigger text-changed events from the AtkText interface. This state supplants @ATK_ROLE_AUTOCOMPLETE.

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_SELECTABLE_TEXT
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates that the object in question supports text selection. It should only be exposed on objects which implement the Text interface, in order to distinguish this state from @ATK_STATE_SELECTABLE, which infers that the object in question is a selectable child of an object which implements Selection. While similar, text selection and subelement selection are distinct operations.

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_DEFAULT
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates that the object is the "default" active component, i.e. the object which is activated by an end-user press of the "Enter" or "Return" key. Typically a "close" or "submit" button.

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_ANIMATED
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates that the object changes its appearance dynamically as an inherent part of its presentation. This state may come and go if an object is only temporarily animated on the way to a 'final' onscreen presentation. **note**: some applications, notably content viewers, may not be able to detect all kinds of animated content. Therefore the absence of this state should not be taken as definitive evidence that the object's visual representation is static; this state is advisory.

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_VISITED
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates that the object (typically a hyperlink) has already been 'activated', and/or its backing data has already been downloaded, rendered, or otherwise "visited".

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_CHECKABLE
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates this object has the potential to be checked, such as a checkbox or toggle-able table cell. @Since: ATK-2.12

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_HAS_POPUP
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates that the object has a popup context menu or sub-level menu which may or may not be showing. This means that activation renders conditional content. Note that ordinary tooltips are not considered popups in this context. @Since: ATK-2.12

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_HAS_TOOLTIP
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates this object has a tooltip. @Since: ATK-2.16

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_READ_ONLY
parameter.parameter_description: Indicates that a widget which is ENABLED and SENSITIVE has a value which can be read, but not modified, by the user. Note that this state should only be applied to widget types whose value is normally directly user modifiable, such as check boxes, radio buttons, spin buttons, text input fields, and combo boxes, as a means to convey that the expected interaction with that widget is not possible. When the expected interaction with a widget does not include modification by the user, as is the case with labels and containers, ATK_STATE_READ_ONLY should not be applied. See also ATK_STATE_EDITABLE. @Since: ATK-2-16

parameter.name: ATK_STATE_LAST_DEFINED
parameter.parameter_description: Not a valid state, used for finding end of enumeration

signal.name: AtkTable::column-deleted

parameter.name: arg1
parameter.parameter_description: The index of the first column deleted.

parameter.name: arg2
parameter.parameter_description: The number of columns deleted.

parameter.name: arg1

parameter.name: arg2
parameter.parameter_description: The number of colums inserted.

parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

parameter.name: atktable
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

signal.name: AtkTable::row-deleted

parameter.name: atktable

parameter.name: arg1

parameter.name: arg2

signal.name: AtkTable::row-inserted
signal.description: The "row-inserted" signal is emitted by an object which implements the AtkTable interface when a row is inserted.

parameter.name: atktable
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

parameter.name: arg1

parameter.name: arg2
parameter.parameter_description: The number of rows inserted.

signal.name: AtkText::text-attributes-changed
signal.description: The "text-attributes-changed" signal is emitted when the text attributes of the text of an object which implements AtkText changes.

parameter.name: atktext
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

signal.name: AtkText::text-caret-moved
signal.description: The "text-caret-moved" signal is emitted when the caret position of the text of an object which implements AtkText changes.

parameter.name: atktext
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

parameter.name: arg1
parameter.parameter_description: The new position of the text caret.

signal.name: AtkText::text-changed
signal.description:
The "text-changed" signal is emitted when the text of the object which implements the AtkText interface changes, This signal will have a detail which is either "insert" or "delete" which identifies whether the text change was an insertion or a deletion.
Deprecated: 2.9.4: Use #AtkObject::text-insert or #AtkObject::text-remove instead.

parameter.name: atktext
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

parameter.name: arg1
parameter.parameter_description: The position (character offset) of the insertion or deletion.

parameter.name: arg2
parameter.parameter_description: The length (in characters) of text inserted or deleted.

signal.name: AtkText::text-insert
signal.description: The "text-insert" signal is emitted when a new text is inserted. If the signal was not triggered by the user (e.g. typing or pasting text), the "system" detail should be included.

parameter.name: atktext
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

parameter.name: arg1
parameter.parameter_description: The position (character offset) of the insertion.

parameter.name: arg2
parameter.parameter_description: The length (in characters) of text inserted.

parameter.name: arg3
parameter.parameter_description: The new text inserted

signal.name: AtkText::text-remove
signal.description: The "text-remove" signal is emitted when a new text is removed. If the signal was not triggered by the user (e.g. typing or pasting text), the "system" detail should be included.

parameter.name: atktext
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

parameter.name: arg1
parameter.parameter_description: The position (character offset) of the removal.

parameter.name: arg2
parameter.parameter_description: The length (in characters) of text removed.

parameter.name: arg3
parameter.parameter_description: The old text removed

signal.name: AtkText::text-selection-changed
signal.description: The "text-selection-changed" signal is emitted when the selected text of an object which implements AtkText changes.

parameter.name: atktext
parameter.parameter_description: the object which received the signal.

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_INVALID
parameter.parameter_description: Invalid attribute, like bad spelling or grammar.

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_LEFT_MARGIN
parameter.parameter_description: The pixel width of the left margin

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_RIGHT_MARGIN
parameter.parameter_description: The pixel width of the right margin

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_INDENT
parameter.parameter_description: The number of pixels that the text is indented

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_INVISIBLE
parameter.parameter_description: Either "true" or "false" indicating whether text is visible or not

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_EDITABLE
parameter.parameter_description: Either "true" or "false" indicating whether text is editable or not

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_PIXELS_ABOVE_LINES
parameter.parameter_description: Pixels of blank space to leave above each newline-terminated line.

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_PIXELS_BELOW_LINES
parameter.parameter_description: Pixels of blank space to leave below each newline-terminated line.

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_PIXELS_INSIDE_WRAP
parameter.parameter_description: Pixels of blank space to leave between wrapped lines inside the same newline-terminated line (paragraph).

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_BG_FULL_HEIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: "true" or "false" whether to make the background color for each character the height of the highest font used on the current line, or the height of the font used for the current character.

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_RISE
parameter.parameter_description: Number of pixels that the characters are risen above the baseline. See also ATK_TEXT_ATTR_TEXT_POSITION.

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_UNDERLINE
parameter.parameter_description: "none", "single", "double", "low", or "error"

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_STRIKETHROUGH
parameter.parameter_description: "true" or "false" whether the text is strikethrough

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_SIZE
parameter.parameter_description: The size of the characters in points. eg: 10

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_SCALE
parameter.parameter_description: The scale of the characters. The value is a string representation of a double

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_WEIGHT
parameter.parameter_description: The weight of the characters.

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_LANGUAGE
parameter.parameter_description: The language used

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_FAMILY_NAME
parameter.parameter_description: The font family name

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_BG_COLOR
parameter.parameter_description: The background color. The value is an RGB value of the format "%u,%u,%u"

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_FG_COLOR
parameter.parameter_description: The foreground color. The value is an RGB value of the format "%u,%u,%u"

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_BG_STIPPLE
parameter.parameter_description: "true" if a #GdkBitmap is set for stippling the background color.

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_FG_STIPPLE
parameter.parameter_description: "true" if a #GdkBitmap is set for stippling the foreground color.

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_WRAP_MODE
parameter.parameter_description: The wrap mode of the text, if any. Values are "none", "char", "word", or "word_char".

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_DIRECTION
parameter.parameter_description: The direction of the text, if set. Values are "none", "ltr" or "rtl"

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_JUSTIFICATION
parameter.parameter_description: The justification of the text, if set. Values are "left", "right", "center" or "fill"

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_STRETCH
parameter.parameter_description: The stretch of the text, if set. Values are "ultra_condensed", "extra_condensed", "condensed", "semi_condensed", "normal", "semi_expanded", "expanded", "extra_expanded" or "ultra_expanded"

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_VARIANT
parameter.parameter_description: The capitalization variant of the text, if set. Values are "normal" or "small_caps"

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_STYLE
parameter.parameter_description: The slant style of the text, if set. Values are "normal", "oblique" or "italic"

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_TEXT_POSITION
parameter.parameter_description: The vertical position with respect to the baseline. Values are "baseline", "super", or "sub". Note that a super or sub text attribute refers to position with respect to the baseline of the prior character.

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_ATTR_LAST_DEFINED
parameter.parameter_description: not a valid text attribute, used for finding end of enumeration

enum.name: AtkTextBoundary
enum.description: Text boundary types used for specifying boundaries for regions of text. This enumeration is deprecated since 2.9.4 and should not be used. Use AtkTextGranularity with #atk_text_get_string_at_offset instead.

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_BOUNDARY_CHAR
parameter.parameter_description: Boundary is the boundary between characters (including non-printing characters)

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_BOUNDARY_WORD_START
parameter.parameter_description: Boundary is the start (i.e. first character) of a word.

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_BOUNDARY_WORD_END
parameter.parameter_description: Boundary is the end (i.e. last character) of a word.

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_BOUNDARY_SENTENCE_START
parameter.parameter_description: Boundary is the first character in a sentence.

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_BOUNDARY_SENTENCE_END
parameter.parameter_description: Boundary is the last (terminal) character in a sentence; in languages which use "sentence stop" punctuation such as English, the boundary is thus the '.', '?', or similar terminal punctuation character.

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_BOUNDARY_LINE_START
parameter.parameter_description: Boundary is the initial character of the content or a character immediately following a newline, linefeed, or return character.

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_BOUNDARY_LINE_END
parameter.parameter_description: Boundary is the linefeed, or return character.

enum.name: AtkTextClipType
enum.description: Describes the type of clipping required.

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_CLIP_NONE
parameter.parameter_description: No clipping to be done

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_CLIP_MIN
parameter.parameter_description: Text clipped by min coordinate is omitted

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_CLIP_MAX
parameter.parameter_description: Text clipped by max coordinate is omitted

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_CLIP_BOTH
parameter.parameter_description: Only text fully within mix/max bound is retained

enum.name: AtkTextGranularity
enum.description: Text granularity types used for specifying the granularity of the region of text we are interested in.

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_GRANULARITY_CHAR
parameter.parameter_description: Granularity is defined by the boundaries between characters (including non-printing characters)

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_GRANULARITY_WORD
parameter.parameter_description: Granularity is defined by the boundaries of a word, starting at the beginning of the current word and finishing at the beginning of the following one, if present.

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_GRANULARITY_SENTENCE
parameter.parameter_description: Granularity is defined by the boundaries of a sentence, starting at the beginning of the current sentence and finishing at the beginning of the following one, if present.

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_GRANULARITY_LINE
parameter.parameter_description: Granularity is defined by the boundaries of a line, starting at the beginning of the current line and finishing at the beginning of the following one, if present.

parameter.name: ATK_TEXT_GRANULARITY_PARAGRAPH
parameter.parameter_description: Granularity is defined by the boundaries of a paragraph, starting at the beginning of the current paragraph and finishing at the beginning of the following one, if present.

signal.name: AtkValue::value-changed
signal.description:
The 'value-changed' signal is emitted when the current value that represent the object changes. @value is the numerical representation of this new value. @text is the human readable text alternative of @value, and can be NULL if it is not available. Note that if there is a textual description associated with the new numeric value, that description should be included regardless of whether or not it has also changed.
Example: a password meter whose value changes as the user types their new password. Appropiate value text would be "weak", "acceptable" and "strong".
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: atkvalue
parameter.parameter_description: the object on which the signal was emitted.

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: the new value in a numerical form.

parameter.name: text
parameter.parameter_description: human readable text alternative (also called description) of this object. NULL if not available.

function.name: atk_action_do_action
function.description: Perform the specified action on the object.

parameter.name: action
parameter.parameter_description: a #GObject instance that implements AtkActionIface

parameter.name: i
parameter.parameter_description: the action index corresponding to the action to be performed

function.return: %TRUE if success, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: atk_action_get_description
function.description: Returns a description of the specified action of the object.

parameter.name: action
parameter.parameter_description: a #GObject instance that implements AtkActionIface

parameter.name: i
parameter.parameter_description: the action index corresponding to the action to be performed

function.return: a description string, or %NULL if @action does not implement this interface.

function.name: atk_action_get_keybinding
function.description:
Gets the keybinding which can be used to activate this action, if one exists. The string returned should contain localized, human-readable, key sequences as they would appear when displayed on screen. It must be in the format "mnemonic;sequence;shortcut".
- The mnemonic key activates the object if it is presently enabled onscreen. This typically corresponds to the underlined letter within the widget. Example: "n" in a traditional "New..." menu item or the "a" in "Apply" for a button. - The sequence is the full list of keys which invoke the action even if the relevant element is not currently shown on screen. For instance, for a menu item the sequence is the keybindings used to open the parent menus before invoking. The sequence string is colon-delimited. Example: "Alt+F:N" in a traditional "New..." menu item. - The shortcut, if it exists, will invoke the same action without showing the component or its enclosing menus or dialogs. Example: "Ctrl+N" in a traditional "New..." menu item.
Example: For a traditional "New..." menu item, the expected return value would be: "N;Alt+F:N;Ctrl+N" for the English locale and "N;Alt+D:N;Strg+N" for the German locale. If, hypothetically, this menu item lacked a mnemonic, it would be represented by ";;Ctrl+N" and ";;Strg+N" respectively.

parameter.name: action
parameter.parameter_description: a #GObject instance that implements AtkActionIface

parameter.name: i
parameter.parameter_description: the action index corresponding to the action to be performed

function.return: the keybinding which can be used to activate this action, or %NULL if there is no keybinding for this action.

function.name: atk_action_get_localized_name
function.description: Returns the localized name of the specified action of the object.

parameter.name: action
parameter.parameter_description: a #GObject instance that implements AtkActionIface

parameter.name: i
parameter.parameter_description: the action index corresponding to the action to be performed

function.return: a name string, or %NULL if @action does not implement this interface.

function.name: atk_action_get_n_actions
function.description: Gets the number of accessible actions available on the object. If there are more than one, the first one is considered the "default" action of the object.

parameter.name: action
parameter.parameter_description: a #GObject instance that implements AtkActionIface

function.return: a the number of actions, or 0 if @action does not implement this interface.

function.name: atk_action_get_name
function.description:
Returns a non-localized string naming the specified action of the object. This name is generally not descriptive of the end result of the action, but instead names the 'interaction type' which the object supports. By convention, the above strings should be used to represent the actions which correspond to the common point-and-click interaction techniques of the same name: i.e. "click", "press", "release", "drag", "drop", "popup", etc. The "popup" action should be used to pop up a context menu for the object, if one exists.
For technical reasons, some toolkits cannot guarantee that the reported action is actually 'bound' to a nontrivial user event; i.e. the result of some actions via atk_action_do_action() may be NIL.

parameter.name: action
parameter.parameter_description: a #GObject instance that implements AtkActionIface

parameter.name: i
parameter.parameter_description: the action index corresponding to the action to be performed

function.return: a name string, or %NULL if @action does not implement this interface.

function.name: atk_action_set_description
function.description: Sets a description of the specified action of the object.

parameter.name: action
parameter.parameter_description: a #GObject instance that implements AtkActionIface

parameter.name: i
parameter.parameter_description: the action index corresponding to the action to be performed

parameter.name: desc
parameter.parameter_description: the description to be assigned to this action

function.return: a gboolean representing if the description was successfully set;

function.name: atk_add_focus_tracker
function.description:
Adds the specified function to the list of functions to be called when an object receives focus.
Deprecated: 2.9.4: Focus tracking has been dropped as a feature to be implemented by ATK itself. If you need focus tracking on your implementation, subscribe to the #AtkObject::state-change "focused" signal.

parameter.name: focus_tracker
parameter.parameter_description: Function to be added to the list of functions to be called when an object receives focus.

function.return: added focus tracker id, or 0 on failure.

function.name: atk_add_global_event_listener
function.description:
Adds the specified function to the list of functions to be called when an ATK event of type event_type occurs.
The format of event_type is the following: "ATK:<atk_type>:<atk_event>:<atk_event_detail>
Where "ATK" works as the namespace, <atk_interface> is the name of the ATK type (interface or object), <atk_event> is the name of the signal defined on that interface and <atk_event_detail> is the gsignal detail of that signal. You can find more info about gsignal details here: https://docs.gtk.org/gobject/signals.html
The first three parameters are mandatory. The last one is optional.
For example: ATK:AtkObject:state-change ATK:AtkText:text-selection-changed ATK:AtkText:text-insert:system
Toolkit implementor note: ATK provides a default implementation for this virtual method. ATK implementors are discouraged from reimplementing this method.
Toolkit implementor note: this method is not intended to be used by ATK implementors but by ATK consumers.
ATK consumers note: as this method adds a listener for a given ATK type, that type should be already registered on the GType system before calling this method. A simple way to do that is creating an instance of #AtkNoOpObject. This class implements all ATK interfaces, so creating the instance will register all ATK types as a collateral effect.

parameter.name: listener
parameter.parameter_description: the listener to notify

parameter.name: event_type
parameter.parameter_description: the type of event for which notification is requested

function.return: added event listener id, or 0 on failure.

function.name: atk_add_key_event_listener
function.description: Adds the specified function to the list of functions to be called when a key event occurs. The @data element will be passed to the #AtkKeySnoopFunc (@listener) as the @func_data param, on notification.

parameter.name: listener
parameter.parameter_description: the listener to notify

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: a #gpointer that points to a block of data that should be sent to the registered listeners, along with the event notification, when it occurs.

function.return: added event listener id, or 0 on failure.

function.description:

function.name: atk_component_contains
function.description:
Checks whether the specified point is within the extent of the @component.
Toolkit implementor note: ATK provides a default implementation for this virtual method. In general there are little reason to re-implement it.

parameter.parameter_description: the #AtkComponent

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: x coordinate

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: y coordinate

parameter.name: coord_type

function.name: atk_focus_tracker_init
function.description:
Specifies the function to be called for focus tracker initialization. This function should be called by an implementation of the ATK interface if any specific work needs to be done to enable focus tracking.
Deprecated: 2.9.4: Focus tracking has been dropped as a feature to be implemented by ATK itself.

parameter.name: init
parameter.parameter_description: Function to be called for focus tracker initialization

function.name: atk_focus_tracker_notify
function.description:
Cause the focus tracker functions which have been specified to be executed for the object.
Deprecated: 2.9.4: Focus tracking has been dropped as a feature to be implemented by ATK itself. As #AtkObject::focus-event was deprecated in favor of a #AtkObject::state-change signal, in order to notify a focus change on your implementation, you can use atk_object_notify_state_change() instead.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: an #AtkObject

function.name: atk_get_binary_age
function.description:
Returns the binary age as passed to libtool when building the ATK library the process is running against.
Since: 2.8
function.return: the binary age of the ATK library

function.name: atk_get_default_registry
function.description: Gets a default implementation of the #AtkObjectFactory/type registry. Note: For most toolkit maintainers, this will be the correct registry for registering new #AtkObject factories. Following a call to this function, maintainers may call atk_registry_set_factory_type() to associate an #AtkObjectFactory subclass with the GType of objects for whom accessibility information will be provided.
function.return: a default implementation of the #AtkObjectFactory/type registry

function.name: atk_get_focus_object
function.description:
Gets the currently focused object.
Since: 1.6
function.return: the currently focused object for the current application

function.name: atk_get_interface_age
function.description:
Returns the interface age as passed to libtool when building the ATK library the process is running against.
Since: 2.8
function.return: the interface age of the ATK library

function.name: atk_get_major_version
function.description:
Returns the major version number of the ATK library. (e.g. in ATK version 2.7.4 this is 2.)
This function is in the library, so it represents the ATK library your code is running against. In contrast, the #ATK_MAJOR_VERSION macro represents the major version of the ATK headers you have included when compiling your code.
Since: 2.8
function.return: the major version number of the ATK library

function.name: atk_get_micro_version
function.description:
Returns the micro version number of the ATK library. (e.g. in ATK version 2.7.4 this is 4.)
This function is in the library, so it represents the ATK library your code is are running against. In contrast, the #ATK_MICRO_VERSION macro represents the micro version of the ATK headers you have included when compiling your code.
Since: 2.8
function.return: the micro version number of the ATK library

function.name: atk_get_minor_version
function.description:
Returns the minor version number of the ATK library. (e.g. in ATK version 2.7.4 this is 7.)
This function is in the library, so it represents the ATK library your code is are running against. In contrast, the #ATK_MINOR_VERSION macro represents the minor version of the ATK headers you have included when compiling your code.
Since: 2.8
function.return: the minor version number of the ATK library

Returns the item associated with this hyperlinks nth anchor. For instance, the returned #AtkObject will implement #AtkText if @link_ is a text hyperlink, #AtkImage if @link_ is an image hyperlink etc.
Multiple anchors are primarily used by client-side image maps.

parameter.parameter_description: an #AtkHyperlink

parameter.name: i
parameter.parameter_description: a (zero-index) integer specifying the desired anchor

Multiple anchors are primarily used by client-side image maps.

parameter.parameter_description: a (zero-index) integer specifying the desired anchor

Gets the hyperlink associated with this object.

parameter.parameter_description: an #AtkHyperlink

function.name: atk_image_get_image_description
function.description: Get a textual description of this image.
